channel.title: Stop lower ranks using commands on higher ranks. [PI]
channel.description: I was wondering if anyone had a quick solution to how to stop lower ranks using commands on higher ranks. I've tried a few things, but I just got some errors. My admins continuously troll me through muting and demoting me. It's funny at first, now it's just annoying >-<...

item.title: Stop lower ranks using commands on higher ranks. [PI]
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

		String other = playerCommand.substring(#);
		Player player = c.getPlayer(other);
		
			if (player.playerRights > c.playerRights) {
					c.sendMessage("You can't use this command on this player");
					return;
				}

You’ll need to tweak it for it to work with your server

Read full topic
item.source: Stop lower ranks using commands on higher ranks. [PI]

item.title: Stop lower ranks using commands on higher ranks. [PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

ohokay:

He wants it so lower player rights can’t use commands on higher player rights, not the layout of a command

It’s in the command.
C’mon… the && playerRights…

Read full topic

item.title: Stop lower ranks using commands on higher ranks. [PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“TheLetterQArousesMe, post:2, topic:491288”]Example: ::ipban String banned = bla bla bla ; if(banned.rights ==/>=/> #) c.sendMessage("You can't ban a #"); else { //other stuff[/quote]
Erm… What? What does that even do? That is the worst… I don’t even…

Flame_:

Can we get a revision type?

It’s 317,

Well… The normal route people do this:

if (playerCommand.equals("command") && c.playerRights == 3) {
//Do Code
}else{
//possible send message code..
return;
}

But there are other (better) systems to do so.

Read full topic

No.[/quote]
:l
wut
